definition: Tianshun Emperor, reign name of eighth Ming Emperor 朱祁鎮|朱祁镇[Zhu1 Qi2 zhen4] (1427-1464), reigned 1457-1464, Temple name Yingzong 英宗[Ying1 zong1]
day/sky/heaven
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
lit. to respond to heaven and suit the times (idiom); to rule according to the will of heaven/the Divine Right of kings

sentences.english: Chai Tianshun was appointed Deputy Director-General of the Quality and Technological Supervision of Henan Province.
sentences.chinese: 任命柴天顺为河南省质量技术监督局副局长。

definition: Jingtai county in Baiyin 白銀|白银[Bai2 yin2], Gansu/Jiangtai Emperor, reign name of seventh Ming Emperor Zhu Qiyu 朱祁鈺|朱祁钰[Zhu1 Qi2 yu4] (1428-1457), reigned 1449-1457, Temple name 代宗[Dai4 zong1]

Yongle Emperor, reign name of third Ming emperor Zhu Di 朱棣[Zhu1 Di4] (1360-1424), reigned 1403-1424, Temple name 明成祖[Ming2 Cheng2 zu3]

reign name of Ming emperor (1573-1619)
Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)

Yingzong, Temple name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3]
Ming Wuzong, temple name of eleventh Ming emperor Zhengde 正德[Zheng4 de2]
Hongxi Emperor, reign name of fourth Ming emperor Zhu Gaochi 朱高熾|朱高炽[Zhu1 Gao1 chi4] (1378-1425), reigned (1424-1425), Temple name 明仁宗[Ming2 Ren2 zong1]
Ming Xizong, Temple name of fifteenth Ming emperor Tianqi 明天啟|明天启[Ming2 Tian1 qi3]
